Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: aslondon33
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we were very disappointed when we checked in to Spectra, especially after reading the endless high reviews. The lobby was undergoing renovations and looked like it was mess. The room we initially checked into was on the first floor had a tiny window that allowed no light into the room. We requested another room and were moved to the fourth floor with slightly bigger window. The rooms were old and worn as were the furnishings in the rooms. Missing light bulbs from fixtures, mini-fridge not well stocked and out of place. The bathrooms were a bit grimy and our sink had major blockage issues. Breakfast buffet was ok - not much of a selection and the same thing is served everyday. The staff were friendly and nice and were happy to help when requested. Aside from the proximity to the Blue Mosque - there is no other reason I would want to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular experience, Hotel Spectra in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Nadine M
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to many exotic places around the world and never inclined to write a review but Hotel Spectra is quite deserving of one. My son and I visited for 9 days in March and just returned from Istanbul. Hotel is in a superbly convenient location, safe for visiting all the major sites such as The Blue Mosque, bear in mind that the call to prayer which is quite loud occurs 5 times a day but after a couple of days you get used to it. The Lobby service staff to name some of the standouts: the Manager, Ozan Eris, and the owner along with Cem and Onur were simply splendid, delightful and most accommodating to requests. It is quite a reputable place. The rooms although on the smaller side are perfectly adequate and quite clean and some have views of the Blue Mosque and views of the Sea, beds were comfortable and bathroom although small was modern with a shower. Breakfast which was included was an excellent spread of fresh local flavor and is served on 5th floor with beautiful views, an elevator services the first four floors. Wi-fi also included and reliable Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Bosphorus Cruise, the Grand Bazar, Spice Bazar, The Cistern, restaurants etc. all within 2 to 15 minutes of the hotel. All of the aforementioned can be accomplished within 3 days and are a must see. Local Tram is also near hotel and quite impressive; we experienced it by hopping to different neighborhoods. Street vendors offering roasted corn on the cob and roasted chestnuts are quite good. Also the vendors with local baked good "simit" are also very good. Other than an abundance of Istanbul cats on the streets and much haggling going on, this is a must visit. We also flew down to Izmir and visited nearby Efes (Ephesus) which is quite worth the time and small expense. . Should we return to Istanbul a second time, we would most assuredly and without hesitation return to Hotel Spectra.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: JF81
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Spectra has some positive and some negative aspects. I'll start with the positive: if you want to be in Old Sultanahmet then the location is superb. You are certainly close to the Blue Mosque. The proximity to the sites of Old Sultanahmet is the primary reason I stayed here. However, if I were planning the trip again I would stay elsewhere (Taksim Square perhaps) because it doesn't take more than a couple days to knock out the attractions of this area of the city, but then you not close to much else in Istanbul. My fiance and I stayed at Hotel Spectra during Ramadan and I enjoyed seeing Muslims do their religious activities near the Blue Mosque. If you are sensitive to sound then beware because the call to prayer and general activities near the hotel will bother you. I found it to be an interesting cultural experience. The rooftop of the hotel has a wonderful view of Old Sultanahmet and we enjoyed eating breakfast each morning on the roof. The breakfast is outstanding and among the best I've had for free at a hotel anywhere. I recall that the woman who set up the breakfast each morning was very sweet and eager to help. On the negatives, the rooms are not especially charming and are very basic. I do realize that "you get what you pay for" so I am not complaining too loudly, just stating a fact. I had one problem with the gentleman at the front desk concerning transfer to and from the airport. It was ultimately resolved favorably, but I recall being annoyed that it took some explaining. As I said above, in my view staying in the Old City was a mistake, but not the end of the world. We still enjoyed Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MMM54
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the best location. You can walk to most of the historical sites as well as to the tram. There are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. The staff was fantastic and the view from the rooftop breakfast room is perfect. The only problem is that the rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Mik901
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Istanbul and for the price and location we couldn't have picked a better Hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful nothing is too much trouble. As mentioned in previous reviews this is not a five star Hotel but the rooms are clean and warm the breakfast buffet excellent and the views from the breakfast table superb. Should we return to Istanbul the Hotel Spectra is where we would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, location and overall value”
Reviews.Author: OlePDX O
Reviews.Content: Tried to pick a hotel online as this was our first time visiting Istanbul! Very happy with our choice based on the other reviews! The staff is knowledgeable and outmost friendly. The room was nice, with great bed linen and very clean! The hotel location is perfect for "tourist" 30 secs walk to the blue mosque... In the middle of the historical district. The staff will make you tea or coffee in the middle of the night if requested! The wifi is a great plus and working well. Breakfast is also good with an amazing view of the harbor and the famous blue mosque. In the end this is not "five star hotel, but for the price it is a fantastic deal"

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it very much and will come back!”
Reviews.Author: Robbert J
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is awesome, we could reach almost everything on foot. The room was not so big but very comfortable and very cosy. We really liked it. The staff is very friendly and very helpfull. They took the time to answer all our questions and were always ready to assist. The breakfast was great. Very friendly staff, excellent view of the Blue Mosque, Haya Sofia and the sea. And the food was delicious!!! And all this for a very reasonable price! We will go back here again

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared for noise!”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyRichmond
Reviews.Content: We got a very cheap deal for two from British Airways 4th to 8th November including bed and breakfast at Hotel Spectra. The location is great for the historical sights in this vibrant city but be prepared for noise. The hotel is very clean and the amenities good though the decor is rather down-at-heel. Typical eastern plumbing and virtually no sound-proofing makes for noise early and late. We were initially in room 103 and as mentioned in previous reviews the whole hotel's plumbing seems to route through this room, rather like living under Niagara Falls!! that was OK but the radiator began continuous clunking at mid-night and made it impossible to sleep! After much fuss we were moved to room 305 where there was still clunking but only every 2 hours for about 10 minutes rather than continuous. We were too afraid to alter the thermostat on the radiator in case of increased noise so slept with the window open, street noise being preferable to continuous clunking. The breakfast was very nice, two of the front desk staff very helpful, one a bit grumpy but I think this is because his English is poor. The bell boy was very pleasant and helpful. Tram system is great and very easy to use. Strongly advise going to the Kempinsky Hotel for a wonderful buffet afternoon tea, great live music while watching the sun go down on the Bosphorus. Served 3-7p.m. 68 Lira per person and includes a glass of Prosecco. Otherwise Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar and Aya Sofia were great, Blue Mosque a bit disappointing. Whirling Dervishes were remarkable. For what we paid we got value for money but if returning I would definitely splash out on a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time in Istanbul Sept. 2011”
Reviews.Author: AS B
Reviews.Content: We had few days in Istanbul before taking a cruise in the Mediterranean. We had book a tour for the day after we arrived and we got a free pick-up from the airport to the hotel. Friendly staff at the airport, safe driver and wonderful hotel staff always ready to help us plan our time in Istanbul. We enjoyed a nice dinner-cruise on the Bosphorus, a private city tour; which I think is the best way to go. It gave us quick access to all the museums, mosque: we only waited 2 minutes so that our guide could by tickets and then we were in visiting and enjoying all the richness, the art, architecture and history of Istanbul. Thanks to the manager at Hotel Spectra we also had a direct transfer to the port of call: making our transition fast and easy. Thanks to Hotel Spectra staff at breakfast also. We had great choices from fruits, to cereals, to pastries and hot meal (eggs, sausages, potatoes) to name a few, but the best part of the breakfast was surely the view...Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and the Sea of Marmara. We will go back to hotel Spectra for our next trip to Istanbul. We loved the location...only one block away from the Blue Mosque and the Hippodrome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: BabsRsmt
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend at the Spectra for 3 nights. The hotel is well situated, just at the end of the Hyppodrome which means walking distance to the major sites in Sultanahmet and to restaurants. The view from the terrace, which you can access at any time, is amazing ; the Blue Mosque, the Bosphorus and Ste Sophie. The breakfast buffet is served on the terrace and is very good. Access to the internet is provided in the lobby (although we did experience a few power failures during our stay) . The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The room was comfortable but avoid the rooms on the 1st floor: very dark and noisy. Tip : Doy Doy is a restaurant within a 5 minute walk and very good. There is also a good candy store right next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: jcroddy
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this hotel! I received some wonderful service during the 9 days I was there from the entire staff, particularly the night staff. I was there on business and returned to the hotel late every night. The concierge was very hospitable and generous. He always offered me tea or coffee to help me relax. We would sit and talk for a bit from time to time. I think his name was Cem, but not positive. I had a great experience there and will return next year.

Reviews.Title: “We'll stay at the Hotel Spectra next time, too”
Reviews.Author: TSTLEO
Reviews.Content: In terms of location, friendliness and value for the money, I can't imagine there'd be any place better to stay in Istanbul than the Hotel Spectra. I first stayed in the hotel in 2006 and couldn't have been happier with my choice. Ozan Eris, Manager of the Hotel Spectra was always cheerful and helpful and did everthing possible to make the stay of my wife pleasant and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location and views”
Reviews.Author: jkgm
Reviews.Content: This pension is at the corner of the Hippodrome across from the Blue Mosque and just a quick walk to Haghia Sophia. Lobby is spacious and computor available as is wi-fi. We arrived at 7:30 am and the staff had a room ready and offered us to have breakfast up on the terrace. The roof top terrace views are absolutely incredible; unobstructed views of the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sophia in one direction, and the Sea of Marma in the other. After exploring the city all day we bought our own appetizers from a local shop and sat on the roof top terace while the lights of the Blue Mosque and Hagiha Sophia sparkled. The area is quiet and peaceful at night. The staff were wonderful and interesting, and interested to talk with their guests; thanks to all and to Ozan Eris. Can't say enough about this pension..some rooms a bit small which we did not mind. Everything else is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “friendly feels like home hotel”
Reviews.Author: dr_khayat
Reviews.Content: stuff friendly , clean and quite rooms , small yes but u only need it for sleep and bath ,perfect location u can't get lost at anytime , i prefer u order shuttle service from airport

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for short people! And other people too, probably.”
Reviews.Author: colemajc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are not tall people. I'm 5'5" and she's 5'3". But what we lack in height we make up for in adventurousness and love of travel. During our stay, the Hotel Spectra in Istanbul catered to all of those characteristics. We stayed in room 405, which was really fun for people of our height. We felt like giants! Both my wife and I could easily reach up and touch the ceiling, which for us, never happens. After a long flight, we were happy to discover that the double bed was super comfortable and there was plenty of room for our tiny bodies! The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They even let us check in early! The free breakfast was awesome, better than most Turkish hotels' breakfasts. The view from the terrace is breathtaking, but be aware that it's fully glassed in now. There's an older photo that shows a previous outdoor incarnation in the reviews. The location of the hotel is excellent. It's a short walk to the Sultanahmet Tram stop and the Blue Mosque is literally across the street from the hotel. To reiterate, we're not that tall, so it takes us a lot of steps to get anywhere, and the short distances to Istanbul's greatest sights we're appreciated. All in all, we had a great stay at the Hotel Spectra. If you're short like us, you'll love it. If you're tall, or medium-sized, you'll probably love it too.

Reviews.Title: “It"s a very nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: seden07
Reviews.Content: Hi, the hotel is small, nice and rustic-style Turkish furnishings. The rooms are very clean. The staff was very nice. I recommend this hotel with 5 stars;-) The location is perfect. right in the center. There are only a few steps to the subway. 2 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque. 5 minutes walk to Hacia Sophia Mosque. Around restaurants, shops and a beautiful park to chill out. Who makes a trip to Istanbul should book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Soothing inviting positive view of Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Schloime
Reviews.Content: Impeccable hospitable staff. Unparalleled view of the Blue Mosque. Incredible breakfast. Excellent access to monuments and public transit.

Reviews.Title: “Once Again - Hotel Spectra Just Gets Better Everytime We Come”
Reviews.Author: ozaer_shah
Reviews.Content: our second trip to Istanbul, and we stayed out the only place we know to stay that we know is comfortable, clean, and a great value. Of course this time, there has been some changes since 2007. We were impressed again with the friendliness, courtesy, and professionalism of this boutique hotel int he heart of Sultanahmet. Its close proximity to the Blue Mosque enabled us to attend every prayer and the call to prayer was heard every morning, which was one of the reasons we stay here. The breakfast buffet was perfect--every kind of morning delight could be found, and the coffee was excellent. With free wifi throughout the hotel, you can relax in the lobby with a cup of tea while you surf and check email. When we return to Istanbul again, we will be of course staying here. Thank you Spectra for making the trip wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Good for seeing the main sights.”
Reviews.Author: ajmbDevon
Reviews.Content: I contacted the hotel by email before and arranged an efficient pickup (25 euros) from the airport at midnight and reception open 24 hours. The lift did not work and our room on the third floor! Everything worked but a bit basic. The room was clean and tidy, kept so by the charming maids. A good buffet breakfast provided and good views of the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque and Bosphorus. All the historic sights and bazaars within walking distance. Expect to be woken at five by the call to prayer, from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Topkapi within a short walk. The bazaars and the Bosphorus, a half hour walk or tram ride. Despite the grey weather, my son and I found Istanbul was fascinating, public transport easy to negociate. Blank hustlers and take the guidebook recommendations for eating. Food can be very good, expect to pay high prices for alcohol. Haggle in the bazaars but only if you want the item.

Reviews.Title: “Great, cheap hotel in the middle of the sights”
Reviews.Author: LovelyLudwig
Reviews.Content: My friends and I booked a room here for 3 and got 3 single beds. We were in the room with the tiny arched window on the floor. We couldn't believe how cheap this place was! The breakfast was really great with a huge variety of food including eggs, breads, yogurt, and so on. It was at the end of a long path off the main street, and extremely close to the Blue Mosque. Like many hotels in the area, it has a top-floor eating area, where you can look out on north, east, and a little bit of western Istanbul. We also couldn't believe that we had free Wi-Fi! Pretty much the only hotel on our trip that allowed us wi-fi access in our room. The only thing that put us off was the singing mosques at 5:30 in the morning - but that occurs in all of Istanbul, not the hotel's fault. On our second day one of the owners came to introduce herself - she was very sweet and told us about the food and asked how we were enjoying the city. Should I ever find myself in Istanbul, I will definitely stay here again. The price is unbeatable!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Istanbul, but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: fruitandnutcake
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Spectra: very helpful staff; clean room; well located for sight-seeing and a good view from our room. Ended up paying over the odds given the size of the bathroom, and the room was fairly basic. To be fair, this was probably due to our last-minute booking, and seems to be more reasonably priced if you book ahead!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ronel_B
Reviews.Content: In December 2010 my partner and I stayed at Hotel Spectra in Sultanahmet for 3 nights and then again for 1 night at the end of our journey. We stayed in many hotels all over Turkey during our 16 day trip and this hotel was the best. It is reasonably priced, clean, and perfectly situated on the corner of the hippodrome and overlooking the Sea of Marmara, Bosphorus, Blue mosque and Haghia Sophia. It is a stone-throw away from the trams and within short walking distance of a local supermarket, the grand bazaar and many other little restaurants. The staff are very friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: alminka13
Reviews.Content: Some club like stile hotel. Feels calm and cozy. It is small but rooms are not. All furniture is matching, windows are nicely framed and could be opened two ways (top and side). There are lots of lights that allow reading. Temperature control is working perfect. The best rooms are ending On â€œ4â€� where you could have a straight view of Blue Masque and hippodrome that is actually a square in front of Masque. The stuff is mild personalities. They are not â€œtoo muchâ€� kind of people (too friendly, to cheerfulâ€¦) and always there for you. There is comp w/printer in the lobby. Breakfast is country stile â€“ simple and fresh. Eggs, omelet, bologna, Variety of cheeses, lots of dry fruits, honey, orange and pomegranate juice And moreâ€¦ The owner of this hotel is famous Turkish physic. (Unfortunately I lost the note w/his name.) Most likely because of that all people who work there have this intelligence attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay Hotel, but good location & Staff”
Reviews.Author: ChilliLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over New Year, so left yesterday. The hotel staff were nice and friendly and helpful, so no complaints there. Except they charge for a map, so get one from a local shop owner for nothing! The hotel is in a good location, with easy access to the blue mosque and trams to get around. The room itself, was a bit shabby looking and not to great to look at. The bed was very hard, but the worst part was the noise in the room! We could hear water running all the time, inside the walls, clearly where the pipes were but we had to go and buy earplugs, also the prayer calling from the mosque, the cleaners going, it was very hard to sleep! Always some noise, so take ear plugs...you will need them. Breakfast was okay, cheeses, olives, bread, eggs, cake etc, but a lady stands there the whole time watching you all eat which I found really uncomforting, so we ate breakfast out for the other 2 mornings, I don't like to be watched whilst I eat! Bit odd, and I didn't really see the point of her being there for a self serve breakfast. Overall, good location, but I probably would stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for exploring Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Judy074
Reviews.Content: A clean, friendly home for us in Istanbul. Breakfasts were great- fresh food and plenty of it, and the view was breathtaking from the Terrace breakfast room. Staff very friendly and helpful. Our room was a good size, and we were so close to everything in the city. Double glazing made for a great night's sleep. Highly recomended- we will come here again all the way from NZ.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy clean hotel, great value in great location”
Reviews.Author: BigJohnWakefield
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the exterior. The hotel is well maintained inside and immaculately clean. The maids do a more thorough job than any other hotel I've stayed in and all the staff are friendly. Breakfast is very good and served in a rooftop terrace with fabulous views. Only 2 minutes wlak to the Blue Mosque and 10 minutes to the Grand Bazaar if returning to Istanbul I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Only 100 Meters from The Hippodrome and Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: ignitebill
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, the Hotel Spectra is one of the best value hotels in Istanbul. Small, very clean and comfortable and about as close to the ancient Hippodrome, Blue Mosque and literally dozens of the most historical sites in Istanbul. The staff were very friendly, helpful and spoke fluent English. Free wireless Internet and one of the best breakfast buffets we could imagine. We were traveling with a dozen other friends from New York, Connecticut and San Francisco (all staying at various hotels), and the Spectra was considered (by far) everyone's "best choice" for economy and proximity. We just returned from an 8-day stay and definitely plan to return in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Cats_123
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask to be any nearer to all the main attractions in Sultanahmet...within 2mns walk of the Blue Mosque, 5mns Hagia Sophia., 10mns tram stop and all the restaurants you could ever want. A small 4 storey hotel on the corner of a busy side street. Clean, comfortable, small rooms but adequate...yes, the Imam starts chanting at 05:00am but what do you expect...we were on the side street which got busy in the mornings but this didn't disrupt our sleep particularly. Staff were friendly and helpful and gave us impartial advice when we asked for it. Lift to 4th floor and then small stairway to rooftop terrace for buffet breakfast. Good range of cold buffet (make you own toast), fruit juices, tea coffee...with great views. We once had to come back later 'cos the room was really busy but that was only when the hotel was full to capacity. Free coffee,tea soft drinks in the reception...free WIFI with boosters on each floor. They had water problems one afternoon but soon resolved...would happily return here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Extremely helpful & friendly staff, Clean Rooms, Value for money.”
Reviews.Author: GauravP1692
Reviews.Content: My family and I, stayed at Spectra Hotel - Istanbul just a couple of days ago and to be perfectly honest - we loved it. The location of the hotel is something that you will absolutely love. Located right opposite the Hippodrome, the Hotel is is close to everything you need to see in Istanbul - The Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Trams, Museums etc. Apart from the location, the Staff is extremely helpful and friendly. I never heard the word 'No' from their mouths as they were ready to do anything for us. Right from providing us with internet access to preparing a few cups of coffee, they are simply brilliant. I would like to get a Special Mention to Mustafa and Onur who took care of us. They were just truly friendly, helpful and amazing people. The rooms too, are very clean and tidy. The hotel is a little small, old building, yet with incredible charm. I would recommend anybody and everybody to give this hotel a shot while in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Location location”
Reviews.Author: Irshadmo2
Reviews.Content: Ok hotel if you want abed for the night . Stayed 5 nights first day there my watch was nicked from the room stair carpets worn out small dirty bathrooms was not happy with room furniture, which was like something out of the 1960s only good thing is the location..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with very helpful staff, and nice and clean.”
Reviews.Author: AucklandOlive
Reviews.Content: The hotel, which is on one corner of the Hippodrome, is close to everything - the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Topkapi Palace, the Grand Bazaar, museums and the trams. It is in an old building, but is very clean. The staff are helpful. The breakfast room on the roof with its view - even out to sea - is a perfect start to the day. As Istanbul is full on, if you want to use your room for constructive breathers, ask for one of the bigger rooms. If you are a light sleeper, keep your windows closed - the 5am call from the surrounding mosques can be very loud. But that will happen anywhere in Istanbul!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely & friendly place”
Reviews.Author: Gemcap
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights and if we go back to Istanbul would stay there again. Right next to the Hippondrome which makes sightseeing so easy, impeccably clean, friendly staff , and an amazing view from the rooftop breakfast area. The rooms are more than adequate in size and the bathrooms while small, adequate.. Hairdryer - Yes Fridge - Yes TV - Yes Kettle - No

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: DGfromKP
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Spectra, Istanbul. The location in Sultanahmet is terrific. And the staff went beyond the normal call of duty to make us welcome and comfortable. Many thanks to you Ali, Mustafa and Ersin.

Reviews.Title: “For location, staff, and price--you can't beat it.”
Reviews.Author: contactcody
Reviews.Content: Everyone recommended that we stay near Taksim Square, but we saw the location of this hotel and the price and opted to not listen to their advice. We don't regret it! As two young ladies visiting Istanbul for the first time, it was so helpful staying in a hotel so close to the major sights. You absolutely cannot beat the view from the breakfast room. We spent at least 45 minutes each day eating a leisurely breakfast just to enjoy the view of Haghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. We didn't have any issues with a lack of food. Neither one of us were awakened by the call to prayer either. The staff was wonderful. They recommended restaurants and tours, and they even gave us a map to show us the nearest pharmacy. They offered us tea whenever we liked. We're sure they probably recommended tours that the hotel was "connected" to somehow, but we took their advice with that awareness in mind. They even reduced the price of a city tour when we suggested we wanted to go with another company. Every day when we returned, they inquired about our day and made sure everything was okay. The only problem we faced was waking up to a lack of running water in our room, but with a quick flip of a switch, the front desk had it fixed immediately. The staff recommended prices for items we were thinking about buying, and they looked up anything we asked. They were extremely helpful. Our room was just fine. We had two beds and plenty of room to walk around. The television is small, but we didn't go to Istanbul to watch TV. The shower is small, but not ridiculous as some reviews suggest. I thought the bed was a little hard, but I slept through every night. We had curtains on the windows for privacy. We stayed on the fourth floor, and never had any issues with privacy. Istanbul in general is full of very "forward" men trying to entice every woman to their restaurant or shop, so it's definitely a place where women need to be aware of their surroundings. That being said, we wouldn't hesitate staying at the same hotel again. We felt safe, but just as in any large city, we wouldn't wander around alone on the streets at night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully situated”
Reviews.Author: SOSSilkeborg
Reviews.Content: It was very easy to book the hotel on the internet. The hotel offered free shuttle from the air port and this functioned perfectly. The hotel is situated right opposite to the Blue mosque and in the middle of the centre of the most interesting places in old Istanbul, i.e. beside the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia Mosque, the Topkapi Palace and the old water reservoir. The wonderful roof terrace, where we had our breakfast, overlooked the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and the Bospherus - so beautiful. The staff was very helpful and friendly and served us free coffee/tea whenever we wanted it. The hotel and the room were very clean, though the room and specially the bathroom was somewhat small. If you are very sensitive to street noise, this may not be the right hotel.But the hotel is absolutely good value for monye, and we would certainly stay there again, if returning to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “great position, good service”
Reviews.Author: pina02
Reviews.Content: Hotel Spectra is in a strategic position for what history is concerned: across the street from the Blue Mezquita ( every morning at about 5 you will be waken by with the prayer , which is not that bad because you will feel where you are even before opening your eyes)) , 10 mins walk from Agia Sofia, 15 mins from Topkapi, 15 mins from Grand Bazar. The first reason to book this hotel is that you will be sipping your morning coffee overlooking the Marmara Sea on one side and the roofs of Agia Sofia and the Blue Mezquita on the other; breakfast is good with a good variety of food. Rooms are very small but cozy, the bathroom is absolutely small and if you wear a "L" size you will not be able to take a shower... you wonÂ´fit into the box !!! Front desk staff is very helpful and are very nice hosts, it doesn.t matter at what time of the day or of the night you get back to the hotel they will be offering you coffee or tea from the house. After a night spent in Taksim a steaming Elma Ciai ( apple tea) is always welcome !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Best Location, Greatest Staff!”
Reviews.Author: wanderingcanuks
Reviews.Content: If anyone is looking for a location centrally and closely located to most fascinating history of Istanbul, don't look any further. Hotel Spectra is ideally located to best historical locations in Istanbul; Grand Bazaar, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Spice Market, and a short streetcar ride away from ferries to Bosphorus, Prince Islands, and Taksim Square. and Beyoglu District. It is a very clean hotel with very comfortable beds in cosy and homey rooms and great strong showers. When you stay at Hotel Spectra, you stay with wonderful people from all around the world visiting Turkey and Istanbul, hosted by the Best Staff we have ever experienced among all other hotels we have stayed in our trips around the world. From Ersin, Umut, Ali and Mustafa at the reception to Guler who prepares the best boreks( turkish filo pastry with dill and feta stuffing) daily fresh and warm alongside the great Turkish and intercontinental breakfasts. Breakfasts are served at the rooftop terrace of the hotel with Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque in view with blue Marmara sea as background and Prince Islands in the distance. Hotel Spectra will be your first welcoming experience that you will always remember and would like to come back to again and again. With the generous and friendly hospitality of all the staff, each time we visited Hotel Spectra, we made great friends among the guest from all over the world. If you are visiting Istanbul, you should experience the Turkish hospitaity with Hotel Spectra and develop memories you will cherish for many years to come, by staying here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Ths Ä±s a very comfortable hotel wÄ±th a frÄ±endly staff and Ä±n an excellent locatÄ±on.”
Reviews.Author: Happy28970
Reviews.Content: ThÄ±s hotel Ä±s Ä±n the Sultanahmet sectÄ±on of Istanbul, and Ä±s wÄ±thÄ±n a few mÄ±nutes walkÄ±ng dÄ±stance from the Sultanahmet Mosque (the Blue Mosque), Aya Sofya Musesi (HagÄ±a SofÄ±a Museum), and TopkapÄ±. It Ä±s also wÄ±thÄ±n walkÄ±ng dÄ±stance of the KapalÄ± Ã‡arÅŸÄ± (Covered Bazaar). It Ä±s also close to the tram lÄ±ne whÄ±ch wÄ±ll take you all over the place. The receptÄ±onÄ±sts speak EnglÄ±sh and are very helpful Ä±n gÄ±vÄ±ng you dÄ±rectÄ±ons Ä±n how best to get to the sÄ±ghts you want to see. The breakfast room Ä±s on the top floor wÄ±th a vÄ±ew of the Blue Mosque, HagÄ±a SofÄ±a, the ObelÄ±sk, and the Bosphorus. A wÄ±nnÄ±ng combÄ±natÄ±on! The food Ä±s delÄ±cÄ±ous, especÄ±ally the TurkÄ±sh food. In case you have not fÄ±gured Ä±t out, when you come to Istanbul you should stay at thÄ±s hotel! LÄ±nda Scheffer

Reviews.Title: “Gem hotel, outstanding views with best staff and location, central delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Acilia1000
Reviews.Content: Being in tourism we have high standards for quality unpretentious hotels and we enjoyed 10 nights in this old fashioned ,spotlessly clean, exceptionally well run hotel in central Sultanahmed owned by retired Physics Professor and Haty who aso owns a quality gift shop nearby on Divan Yolu street .(Tram area) Fabulous views of the Hippodrome with sights from our corner room-double, en suite double-glazed windows (remember to close them) for quiet at night, lavish typical turkish breakfast with view of Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque, everything, even Grand Bazaar within 5 to 10 mins walking distance. Moustafa, Honor, Guler, Ali, Umut , Haitin were amazing and kind staff- always offering something extra in terms of tea or service. They went the extra mile. You feel like you have friends on holiday!! We even made a friend a little higher up the street-direction Grand Bazaar with restaurant owner Yabaci Kardesler (patronised by turks, not tourists) who made the most delicious turkish food!! Iskender kebab (lamb stew) and Patlican kebab(aubergine). After we found it we realised we have to share our great experiences about the hotel and restaurant with everybody!!! Istanbul is gorgeous and very safe, enjoy it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value in the Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Ironwain
Reviews.Content: Small but adequate rooms that are very clean; very attentive and helpful staff; excellent Turkish breakfast with very good variety.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent situated Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: claes-goran
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at Hotel Spectra Istanbul between 27.4-4.5 2010. The hotel is exellent situated at the front of the Hippodrome and Blue Mosque, within walking distance to Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and Grand Bazar, and only 5 minutes walk to the Metropolitan Tram station. Our flight to Istanbul was cancelled three times during 10 days due to the ash clouds from the vulcano on Iceland, but the staff at Hotel Spectra was able to handle the situation, they replayed very fast and accurate when we had to change our reservations, wich we give them high credit for. The Hotel is very cosy and the staff is very friendly and helpfull, you feel that you have known them for years. We also had a free transfer from the airport to the hotel. The nice breakfirst is served at the glazed roof terrace, with a wonderfull view over the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque and Marma see! If we come back to Istanbull, we will stay at Hotel Spectra for following reason, the location of the hotel, the friendly staff and the breakfirst at the roof terrace. Hotel Spectra is highly recommendable. Claes-Goran and Eivor

Reviews.Title: “WARNING: TripAdvisor maps hotel incorrectly”
Reviews.Author: cperlmutter
Reviews.Content: We knew which neighborhood we wanted to stay in, and chose this hotel based mainly off of its location. TripAdvisor mapped the hotel incorrectly and it was actually in a very different part of town. This was very disappointing, we were miles from where we wanted to be. There is nothing wrong with the hotel if that is where you want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a welcome!”
Reviews.Author: Cyprustravels
Reviews.Content: Together with four friends all from Northern Cyprus we have just spent five great days at this hotel. Other reviewers have spoken of the welcome and service of the staff and we would all echo that -- the guys can't do enough to help you whether it's information about where to go or what to see or yet another round of coffee and tea. Thank you from us all and congratulations to the new manager! The breakfast room on the top floor is stunning -- the views across the Bay of Marmaris and the Blue Mosque; together with the delicious food are great ways to start the day. Our room was quite small but the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom could do with a bit of a makeover and it would be really good to have just one chair to sit on after all the hours of walking around the city!! So what I would say finally is choose this hotel with the confidence of knowing that you will be treated enormously well -- we had a great time -- thank you

Reviews.Title: “If we could have stayed longer, we would have..”
Reviews.Author: DadofG
Reviews.Content: We were "forced" into making a stopover in Istanbul when the flights were cancelled due to the volcano and we chose Hotel Spectra from a guide book because it was idelly situated for the rail station and the main sights. Our arrival was met with great friendliness, offers of tea or coffee and fruit juice for our son. Our room was ideal for the three of us with everything that we needed. Eating breakfast on the (covered) roof terrace overlooking the Blue Mosque was a bit special - although such proximity does have its drawbacks with the call to prayer in the early morning. As our train was not until the evening, they looked after our bags after we checked out and when we came to collect them - after a day's hard sightseeing - we were given further tea and juice. The level of hospitality and care was unprecedented in my experience, I would happily return and for a simple, well located and good value hotel, it can't be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and friendly atmosphere !!”
Reviews.Author: dedkede
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at Spectra hotel.The friendly and outgoing staff made it a more comfortable and memorable experience.We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Super Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JuneWindsor
Reviews.Content: Spectra hotel is a cozy haven in located in the historic district of Sultanahmet Istanbul. This was the second time that is stayed at this hotel. It was just as charming as I remembered. It is within walking distance to many historical sites and architectural marvels. Not to mention shopping at the famous Grand Bazaar. The staff at this hotel is fantastic. They treat guests like good friends or family and go out of their way to make guests comfortable. We enjoyed the fresh bread with wonderful jams and fruits served at breakfast. It was very nice way to start the day. Our housekeeper was very kind and our room was very clean. Our host at the front desk Ersin always greeted us with a warm smile to brighten our day. He was always courteous and thoughtful by offering us tea. The staff really made us feel welcome and at home. I recommend this hotel for the location, value, yummy breakfast, and most importantly the atmosphere created by thestaff. I will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, warm and inviting”
Reviews.Author: DrJ99
Reviews.Content: It's like a home away from home. No worries, very friendly and helpful staff. Clean rooms. Tea always available in the lobby. Very convenient location - right near the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya and near the tram to get elsewhere in the city. And there were always beautiful flowers in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely worth the money...”
Reviews.Author: friggie49
Reviews.Content: No, this is not a four star hotel, but the Hotel Spectra makes up for it in lots of other ways. It's VERY centrally located to all the great attractions Istanbul has to offer --- Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and the bazaar a short walk away. There are TONS of small restaurants open late all around the hotel's vicinity, which makes it very convenient to grab late night snacks and sit outside at one of the lovely cafes. The rooms are small, but comfortable and well maintained. The staff is as friendly as can be and were very helpful in suggesting places to eat and local attractions not to be missed. The wireless internet service worked flawlessy. Hotel Spectra also had one of the best breakfast spreads around on a lovely rooftop where you can look out over the water and see the grandeur of the Blue Mosque. It is a perfect hotel for its price range and offers amazing convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!!!! Great location!!! Amazing service!!!”
Reviews.Author: debbi19
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the view from the hotel even better. Enjoy a delicious breakfast with the magical view of Agia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. The rooms are very charming and clean. The hospitality we felt from all the staff made us feel at home. Thank you Ersin and Ali for the warm delicious tea on those cold days! You definitely made our stay even more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Second time there - perfect”
Reviews.Author: sotiris93
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in Hotel Spectra, this time for orthodox easter. Again, everything was superb- the cleanness, the breakfast, the service. All my friends were greatly satisfied. Only one negative thing, I hope that the internet connection in the lobby will be better next time. For there will be a next time!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel. Stunning view.”
Reviews.Author: toma348
Reviews.Content: Located directly at the Hippodrome/Sultanahmet Square. Very friendly and extremely helpful staff. Free tea/coffee around the clock. Rooms small, but very clean and comfortable. Sattelite tv and free wireless internet in the rooms. Nice breakfast in the roof terrace, with absolutely stunning view of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and the sea. Would stay there again next time in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “In Touch with the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: BigJohnShropshire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a twin bedded room looking out at the Blue Mosque - a mere 300metres away across the ancient Hippodrome - and there's no need for early alarm calls as the loudspeakered call to prayers does this job really well, just after 5.30am! The room was warm, clean, comfortable; the beds & room were cleaned every morning & new towels were issued. The TV and the minibar worked, as did the shower & phone. We paid Â£49 a night and this included a varied & generous continental breakfast eaten on the 5th floor in the rooftop glassed terrace - with great views over the Hippodrome and down onto the Bosphorus. Staff were friendly and helpful and the small lift carried two people in a friendly fashion. The hotel is old and quite cramped; the foyer is rather dark and old-fashioned yet the internet is freely available and clientele are from all over the world. Great value - especially as its great location meant that one could visit nearly ALL the main tourist sites with ease via bus, taxi, tram, dolmus or on foot. Obviously it's not a swanky place but it suited us for our week's stay and I would happily recommend iut to anyone like us who object to paying high prices for a night's sleep when you can do so in an clean and well-managed hotel with all the basic comforts on tap for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, it is quiet, nice people working here and clean.”
Reviews.Author: eagle2Istanbul
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to others. the rooms are little smal but good and clean hotel with good service. Of all the hotels in Istanbul this is the hotel with best location if you visit the city as a tourist. You will also get good breakfast with an excellent view over the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel in wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: travelliteleigh
Reviews.Content: Small hotel (19 rooms) in the most perfect location just across road from Blue Mosque. Slightly faded and at times very cold, heating could have come on slightly earlier, but staff most welcoming, offering free hot drinks when we returned weary from walking round the main tourist attractions in the old part of Istanbul. Wonderful views from rooftop breakfast area. Ideal spot for a short stay in a wonderfully historic city.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, but our experience was marred by hotel receptionist”
Reviews.Author: neilsolaris
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous reviews, in that the hotel is in a great location, with a beautiful view of the Blue Mosque from the breakfast room. The breakfast was very good, and the rooms were fine, so we felt it was good value for money. However, our experience was completely spoiled by a hotel receptionist as we checked out this morning (20th Feb 2010). The receptionist in question is a young looking guy (I'm guessing in his 20's) with an outwardly surly demeanor. As we checked out he asked us if we had used anything from the minibar. We said we hadn't (which of course was true). He then looked at us accusingly, and asked if we were sure. We both responded: "yes, of course we're sure". He repeated this question, so we reconfirmed. He then hesitated, before asking us if we had had the nuts! At this point, we were both starting to feel somewhat annoyed. Instead of accepting our word, he continued with his cross examination, stating that there had been a record of nuts being removed from the minibar on the 17th. At this point I responded that if I had eaten the nuts I would have been honest and admitted it. A long awkward pause entailed, and at which point he nodded and muttered "ok", which indicated that we were free to leave! He did not say goodbye, not offered us any other appropriate exchange. Because of this regrettable experience, we will not be coming back to this hotel, nor are we able to recommend others to stay here. On a slightly less serious issue, we asked this same receptionist for some advice regarding catching the public ferry to a certain location. He tried very hard to steer us away from this trip, and instead persuade us to accept an expensive tour, which no doubt he gets some commission for. A similar thing happened with another receptionist here. Therefore, be mindful that you might not receive unbiased advice from the receptionists.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is the perfect family hotel”
Reviews.Author: lleandra
Reviews.Content: the hotel was extremely clean..with an ideal location..the staff were very pleasant and accomodating..and nothing seemed to much trouble..

Reviews.Title: “worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: E_Akdemir
Reviews.Content: i have recently visited Istanbul and stayed in this hotel for 5 days. very convenient location and friendly staff made our choice right. also the staff will go out of their way just to make sure you are satisfied with their hotel. the hotel room is cozy and will answer your demands. we enjoy our breakfasts at the terrace which has beautiful view of both blue mosque and marmara sea. i strongly recommend this hotel. they have really affordable rates and i really think that they are charging under the avarage around that area. will definitely stay again on my next trip. E. Akdemir Houston, Tx

Reviews.Title: “A week of warm and homely treatment!”
Reviews.Author: latamiyer
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended Spectra Hotel to me. Right from the moment when I wrote an email to them, the hotel's professionalism and prompt responses were evident. My flight was delayed but the hotel handled this extremely well and I was picked up right on time. The stay was smooth and without a hitch. And I would say that all credit goes to the enthusiastic and super friendly staff. The rooms are clean and inviting. The lobby is like a living room at home rather than a cold hotel lobby. The staff never fails to offer you a nice and hot cup of coffee (free of charge)! They even provided me a daily dose of bagel just because I was vegetarian. They went to great lengths to organize the tour for me, send me to dervish rituals or to the hamam for a nice scrub. The manager even accompanied me to the ATM. It is bang next to the Hippodrome. The breakfast room is like another world - it is impossible to forget the hazy view of the blue mosque and Hagia Sofia from there early morning. The seagulls with their capers outside the glass enclosures is the lasting image I carry from my wonderful stay at Spectra! I would recommend this hotel to those for whom warmth, homeliness, personal assistance and a historic atmosphere are important!

Reviews.Title: “great people”
Reviews.Author: seyhanuzun
Reviews.Content: thats our second time at the spectra hotel. we didnt bring kids this time. people are so friendly who works in the hotel. breakfast lady does her best for you to have nice breakfast and she is really good about it. also reception stuff are very helpfull. (not only the costumers even people who asks the direction) also hotel has best locotion for the istanbul. rooms are good..

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: aussiesal32
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Hotel Spectra 3 times now and feel we should write about it now . It was recommended to us by friends and now is our home away from home. We have stayed in 3 different rooms and they all had stunning views of the Blue mosque and over the Sea of Marmara and the old roof tops of Istanbul. The view from the Breakfast room is stunning . We have sat here at all hours just soaking it up. The breakfast spread is typically turkish, with many choices and very good quality food. The best that we had anywhere in a 4 week trip around Turkey. The rooms are comfortable with very good mattresses, immaculate linen, very clean small bathrooms and great friendly helpful staff that clean every day. The rooms have been substantially upgraded since our trip in 2008 and are now sound proofed with double glazing. I slept through the call to prayer this time the rooms where so quiet. The foyer is set up with a comfy lounge area, 24 hour access to computer and tea coffee and drinks provided at any time. The staff, especially Ersin are friendly and helpful with great information about places both the tourist sites but also those of the beaten track. You step out of the hotel straight into the space of the Hippodrome and it is 1 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and only a couple to The Aya Spohia and the topkapi Palace.Central to everything. The tiny side street has a Laundry service, and some wonderful local cafes where we were welcomed and ate with the locals unbelievably cheaply. Again we would not stay anywhere else and plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Made Istanbul Even Better”
Reviews.Author: RachanaMundra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Spectra for a week in December, 09. Four of us (two adults and two kids) were sharing a room. The room and the bathroom that they gave us were small, but very clean. And the view from the room was AWESOME! We could see the Blue Mosque from our room window. At night, we could sit there just watching the birds flying over the mosque. The location was perfect. Topkapi palace, Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, Spice Market and Grand Bazaar were in walking distance. So were the ferries and the tram station. There were some great restaurants around as well. They arranged to pick us up from the airport and drop us off. Saving the best for last, the breakfast was FABULOUS. Guler put together the best collection of cakes, bread, olives, helva, rose jam and other jams. We spent one hour on breakfast every morning. My kids, who usually don't have a good appetite, sat there wolfing down their meals. The tours offered at the hotel maybe a little expensive, so it is better to ask around.

Reviews.Title: “Value, location, and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: History-buffs-3
Reviews.Content: For a family of three adults from California interested in the history of Istanbul and willing to spend two weeks indulging ourselves in it, Hotel Spectra was the perfect location. After a day of walking and exploring, the smiling face with Turkish tea or apply tea ready in the lobby was a great comfort. The hotel is easy access to major sites including the Turkish and Islamic Art Museum a few steps away, as well as public transportation that is easily navigated. The museum houses the best collection of Turkish rugs in the world. Breakfast was wonderful and healthy. The bowl of tahini among the bowls of jams was a bit baffling until I finally asked the hostess what to do with it. She very graciously explained that a spoonful of tahini on top of a couple of spoonfuls of what appeared to be a very thick prune sauce was the intended combo. It is a fabulous taste experience for those interested in exploring culinary treats!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Feelgood!”
Reviews.Author: WoodlanderCacak
Reviews.Content: Breakfast is very good, but the view from the roof while having it is magnificient. Ersin is a great host, he knows all you need to know and happy to assist in everything. It is clean, rooms are small but charming. Location could not be better, traffic is low so is the noise, just a light walk through the park till you get to public transport. Olives are the best I ever had. For the price we paid it is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Real hospitality!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marina-Adriana
Reviews.Content: Very nice place without bla-bla! Honest,family feeling. Ideal situated in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Our Istanbul home base”
Reviews.Author: spark55
Reviews.Content: We only had a few days to see Istanbul but I can't imagine a better location for access to many of the major sites and trams - most within a 10 minute walk. We arrived in the evening and Ersin still took the time to sit down and talk with us about our stay and give us much needed information to plan the next day. Then a "10 minute" walk up the street to a relaxing Turkish bath at the historic Cemberlitas bath house. We slept like babies that night in a room set up with 3 separate beds. We arose early to a tasty breakfast on the top floor( I still miss the breads,olives and cheeses) with a view of the bosphorus and blue mosque and roman obelisk plus many others as the sun rose higher on the horizon. It could use a little better internet reception in the rooms but for my money I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best place we stayed at in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianDreamers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at three hotels. The Blue House, The Seven Hills Hotel and Hotel Spectra in Istanbul. All the hotels were clean and in great locations. They were all within walking distances to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grande Bazaar and the trams. They all provided the same food for breakfast. They all had WiFi internet. But if you want your moneys worth stay at Hotel Spectra. Hotel Spectra provided everything you needed in a hotel, still maintaining the quality as the others but it was half the price. Service is also important to us. We noticed in the Blue House, that if you were not smartly dressed, you didn't receive great service. At Hotel Spectra, the service was amazing. We would like to thank Dr.Ziya, Ersin and Umut for their wonderful hospitality. We are forever grateful for your kindness. Thank you for showing us where to find the pharmacy, grocery store, and travel operator, providing us comfort food and unlimited tea- the list is so long. We had fallen in love with a beautiful country, not only because of the wonderful sites and history that Turkey provided, but also because of the warmth and generosity of the people who live there. My husband and I are travelling around the world for a year and we have stayed at many hotels. If you want a clean, quality hotel in a great location and for a great price stay at Hotel Spectra. A great starting point for your first stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “IT,S A NICE, COMFORTABLE AND VERY WELL LOCATED HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: taradax
Reviews.Content: Its a nice , comfortable and very well located hotel. The views from the terrace (where the breakfast is served) are astonishing!!! Bue Mosque and Santasofia while you eat the wonderfull bread "simiti"

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: nandupress
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Istanbul was made more memorable by staying at the Spectra Hotel. Full of atmosphere, charm, and a great staff, I can't imagine staying anywhere else in the city. As others have mentioned, the breakfast room has the best view of any hotel in the city, giving you the full skyline of the Blue Mosque and the Ayia Sophia from one vantage point, and the night views as inspiring.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Spectra - Outstanding value for the cost”
Reviews.Author: Praxisator
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from the most enjoyable holiday we have ever taken â€“ to Istanbul and beyond. What makes a holiday enjoyable: the place you stay, the service provided, the food and the places you see. The Hotel Spectra is a small boutique hotel in the heart of the Sultanahmet District, which is the oldest part of the city. It was our home for ten days. Because of its location (across the street from the Hippodrome and the Blue Mosque and within easy walking distance to all of the historic places that you will want to see) and the quality of the services provided we would not hesitate to recommend the Hotel Spectra. Our room was spacious and comfortable; the bed excellent. The hotel staff was responsive and helpful providing advice about where to eat, shop, where the closest ATM was, how the tram works, and arranging tickets for shows, etc. All of that aside, the memory that will stay with us forever was the panoramic view we had from the terrace over breakfast: stele in the Hippodrome, the domes and minarets of the Blue Mosque and the Haghia Sophia and the Sea of Miramar. Over 2,000 years of history at a glance â€“ incredible! And, the breakfast buffet was excellent: juice, six cheeses, bread, olives, meats, yogurt, fruit, cereal, coffee and tea. Staying in the Hotel Spectra was like visiting friends. We will definitely go back to Turkey and when we do we will stay in the Hotel Spectra. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. Steve and Michele Edwards Baker City, OR

Reviews.Title: “without hotel spectra, our trip would have been incomplete!”
Reviews.Author: mohammed786
Reviews.Content: when we got to istanbul, we wanted to be adventurous and find a hotel ourselves. we were on a tight budget and we were exhausted before long of walking around looking for hotels. so, we spotted hotel spectra and went in, we expected it to be really expensive as it was literally across the road to the blue mosque.but, to our suprise the reception team was very welcoming and very negatiable, we got a reasonable price and a nice room. but what we particularly enjoyed about hotel spectra was the fact that the hotel team really helped us in getting around istanbul, we truly felt that the hotel team went the extra mile in making our trip memorable. not forgetting to compliment the services, our rooms were cleaned daily, breakfast was on time and security was tight. we couldnt ask for more. to finish, i must say, all my trips to istanbul will, hopefully, be at hotel spectra. i would more then recommend this hotel to anyone, whether they be students on a short trip, coulples or even senior citizens, everything about hotel spectra caters for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Adding everything up it would be hard to better Hotel Spectra”
Reviews.Author: Mitchblake
Reviews.Content: Before we left home a friend who is a frequent visitor to Istanbul had recommended the Hotel Spectra. From the time we were picked up by the Hotel Transport until we left for Ankara 6 days later we had nothing but praise for the Hotel and its staff. On arrival Ersin the Duty Manager made us welcome, sat with us over coffee or tea (chi) and explained in excellent conversational English were to go and what to see while in Istanbul. This friendly welcome continued right throughout our stay. Most of the places you would want to visit while in Istanbul are within easy walking of Spectra. Between site seeing we would often sit in the hotel lobby and chat to Ersin or Dr Ziya Sumengen the owner. They truly made you feel like friends rather than guests. The rooms were clean, tidy and comfortable with efficient air con, good on-suits with excellent shower with 24 hour hot water. Spectra is justifiably proud of its breakfast served in the roof top conservatory. While a couple of others may have come close this was certainly the best breakfast we had during our 5 weeks touring round Western and Central Turkey. We would love to go back to Turkey and spend more time in Istanbul and we would certainly stay at Spectra again.

Reviews.Title: “We would return tomorrow”
Reviews.Author: Gonkboy
Reviews.Content: I can verify all of the good things mentioned in previous reviews. Great staff, fantastic position close to all of the Old Town key sites. I would recommend the restaurant next door and one or two pleasent bars that face the Hippodrome and are no more than 20 metres away

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: TiredTraveller091
Reviews.Content: I am just finishing my 7th stay in 2 years at the Hotel Spectra. This hotel was recommended to me, and I would not hesitate to recommend it to others. The staff are more like family. The only problem with the hotel is that the rooms are small. The location is excellent. The room rate is good. Travel advice has proved to be excellent, including recommendations on tours. The breakfast room on the terrace gives a nice view of the Blue mosque and the Marmara sea. Plenty of nice cafes and restaurant's nearby. Close to Grand Bazaar and Spice Market.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: brandilun
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a block from a host of tourist attractions. The fifth floor breakfast room had amazing views of the area. We often went up and sat there at night to take in the skyline of the city. The staff was incredibly helpful. I was travelling with a friend who became sick. They provided her with an endless supply of tea and helped us find the only local pharmacy open on a Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: elmanelman
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent breakfast on the terrace to beautiful view, clean rooms, friendly staff. The only small issue was the noise of air conditioner. It was a bit louder than normal.

Reviews.Title: “Not something special but it was ok”
Reviews.Author: velissarios1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on July during my trip to Istanbul.It wasn't something special since there are better hotels in Istanbul(same category).My room was quite small but clean. The breakfast terrace had great view of the Blue Mosque and Haya Sofia since the hotel was located very close to the above sights.Breakfast was average.The staff was very helpful,kind and willing to give you information about the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great stuff”
Reviews.Author: pakistanimran
Reviews.Content: I visit istanbul for the first time and stayd at hotel spectra. I would like to give hotel 100 % mark, because of great stuff, great breakfast in the morning and specially where the hotel is. everyting is so close that u dont need to take taxi to visit differents tourist places. Thanks to the stuff who helpend oss all the time with great smile on there faces.God bless you all.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: trval68
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel. It is very clean, the reception people speak good english and they are always willing to help. the location is brilliant. the room has a good feeling of warmth and cosiness. the guests have access to internet and I was able to change my flight and print the details from the hotel. the breakfast room has a stunning view and the breakfast has plenty of choice. the hotel is quiet, apart from the morning pray which can he heard very well from the nearby mosque, but it adds charm to the stay ! Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Better choices out there”
Reviews.Author: redfury
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Spectra hotel because of their location as well as a breakfast terrace that has a view of the Blue Mosque. Spectra indeed had both, but there were no other positives about this place. We booked 4 nights through Expedia and arrived one day early. After a long day of driving we arrived at 9pm expecting a warm reception. We were told that there was a room available for the extra night, but they refused to match the price we were paying for the next 4 nights. I asked why I should pay more when I could simply go online and book it for cheaper and he said "go ahead". What made it even more ridiculous was that we were paying around 52 Euros/night for the days we booked, he wanted 60 Euros for the extra night, and we saw the sheet showing that Expedia only gives them 40Euros! If we could have cancelled we would have left immediately. The breakfast terrace does have a nice view, but don't count on a good breakfast. The woman that serves it cuts up a couple of tomatoes, a cucumber or two, a small part of a watermelon, all of which are gone after a few people have eaten. She does not replace them and looks very surprised when you ask if there is any more tomato. There is bread, cheese and yogurt, but get there bright and early for the fruit. They will also ruin the peaceful atmosphere by loading the dishwasher, which is cramped in with the tables in a very small area, nice and slowly. The rooms were nothing special. No sound-proofing whatsoever, shower hose was broken and spraying all over. Despite having routers on each floor, the internet signal is very weak in the room we were in. There are two networks, and using the lobby connection IN the lobby is your best bet, or even plug into the router near the lobby computer. There was one female staff member who was incredibly nice who offered me tea and rearranged some coffee tables for me to use my laptop in the lobby. I can see some people having a good time at Spectra if they get a good room and are fortunate enough to only interact with the friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Spectra”
Reviews.Author: Calibi
Reviews.Content: Spectra is a lovely hotel with views of the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Good value, very good and friendly desk help, excellent breakfast spread, comfortable rooms, well-restored Ottoman house. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “clean but too small room”
Reviews.Author: Gurgaonvisitor
Reviews.Content: the room was clean, but much too small for a family of three (two adults and an eleven year-old). We shifted to a nearby hotel after three days which was much roomier, better lobby, more helpful staff for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we stayed in during 5 weeks in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: JocelynNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location beside Blue Mosque. Excellent breakfast - both in variety and quality and an uninterrupted roof top view of Blue Mosque and Bosphorus. Helpful staff - good English spoken. Clean, Quiet, handy to everything - Bazaar, Restaurants, Mosques, Topkapi Palace, Hamams, Supermarket etc. Another bonus - it has a lift!!! We would recommend this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “the perfect hotel to be in the middle of things”
Reviews.Author: thehalls63
Reviews.Content: Hotel position ideal. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast on the roof was fine. Rooms were small but beds comfortable. Bathroom again small, only one at a time but very clean and the walk in shower brilliant. Would recommend to any one. We would certainly stay there agailn.

Reviews.Title: “I would certainly recommend the Hotel Spectra in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Tizer13_9
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Hotel Spectra in Istanbul. We chose this hotel after reading reviews on here, which seemed to be consistently good - and after our experience, accurate. The staff were very friendly, helpful and accommodating - they could recommend trips, restaurants etc. but weren't pushy. The hotel was clean and rooms were cleaned daily with fresh towels. There was free internet access. Location was good too - in walking distance from many sights and places of interest. It was quiet during the night - apart from the 5am prayers from the Blue Mosque! I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The warmest welcome, an encompassing feeling of being home and among friends!”
Reviews.Author: TikalTatras
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! From the welcoming cups of caj, to the wealth of information provided by staff members (who don't try to sell you anything), Spectra could not have been more helpful. It is located on the corner of the Hippodrome with amazing views of all the the big sites from the enclosed rooftop breakfast room. The breakfast room is always open, so often people enjoy a late night glass of wine (you provide it) overlooking the floodlit Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya. The seagulls glide over the minarets with the ethereal light from below. In the morning light, it becomes a breakfast room with lots of homemade treats and a great selection of typical Turkish items. We had a three night stay (were greeted by a driver which is free with three night min). We were planning on returning to Istanbul the following weekend after a four night trip to Cappadocia, but were not sure of the exact days and didn't think it would be a problem to get a room on Easter weekend....WRONG. The Sultanahmet district was essentially full. The Spectra staff spent quite of bit of uncompensated time trying to find us accommodations. Ultimately after two nights in the newer section of town, we were able to return to Spectra for our last night in a great corner triple room. The Spectra was built as a large private home in the mid 1800s, so room sizes tend to be smaller, as in many boutique hotels. Reponse to complainer review: many Euro hotels have motion sensors for hallway lighting. Would we go back to Spectra? Of course! It was like staying with family and truly an amazing way to be introduced to Turkish culture.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but noisey and run down”
Reviews.Author: SortedNet
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for a site seeing trip but is very run down. It has obviously had a very poor quality conversion at some point in its history with the first floor rooms jammed in with the tops of the ground floor windows being the only light. The room divisions were very thin. We stayed in two rooms (the first was appalling the second just bad) and in both the noise from the corridor and other rooms was very apparent. Street noise was also a problem, even on the top floor, due to badly fitted single glazed windows (which were also very draughty). When we left the hotel in the mornings there was always a guest trying to change to a quieter room so it was not just the two rooms we stayed in. The reception and hallways were very dark with movement sensitive lights which often required you to wave your arms around to get some light. The rooms were fitted with an â€˜energy savingâ€™ device which required you to put your key in a slot for the light to work. This ended up with you groping around for the slot every time you came into the room. The bathrooms were so small it was difficult to actually sit on the toilet and in the second room I could only stand upright in the show and had to bend nearly double to use the sink. On arrival we were offered tea then subjected to constant sales of restaurants, cruises and other attractions. Even trying to leave the hotel ended up with the receptionist showing us to a nearby restaurant he recommended while he was â€œgoing out for something to eat himselfâ€�. The plus side was the breakfast. The terrace was very nice although it was difficult to get to and from the tables to the buffet as the tables were really jammed in. There was a good selection on the buffet and helpful staff at hand. If this hotel were half the price it would become reasonable but as it is I really would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: CanadianCouple51
Reviews.Content: We spent a lovely week at this hotel in early March. It is very well situated at the corner of the Hippodrome with fabulous views of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was a highlight with lots of choice and wonderful views to start your day. We'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rivg12
Reviews.Content: Reviewer: RamÃ³n Villar from Monterrey, MÃ©xico. As you must know, the most representative landmarks of Istanbul are definitely the Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. Well, if you stay at Spectra Hotel you will just be steps away from these icons. When I first arrived at the hotel, I was congratulating myself for choosing such a perfect spot. Just after I entered the hotel I was received by Erzin which is an incredible nice man. He offered me free apple tea (which tasted like heaven) and then he grabbed a map and explained to me the best places to visit in Istanbul (which by the way, a lot of them are not far away from the hotel for example, the Topkapi palace or the Grand Bazaar). The room was great, very nice and clean with a great view of the Blue Mosque. The breakfast was very well served and the dining room has as well an incredible view. Finally, besides Erzin, there is also an incredible nice young man at the hotel named Mustafa. I remembered one day, he even agreed to take me to the Grand Bazaar and look up for the best prices. So if you are planning to go to Istanbul, believe me thereÂ´s no better place to stay than Spectra Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Oletared
Reviews.Content: We can only echo the positive comments about the Spectra: wonderful staff, convienent location, comfortable bed (they put 2 singles together for us), ample breakfast (including yummy home made jam), great view of the Blue Mosque from the breakfast room. Our clean room was not cramped, the furnishings, while not new, had character, and everything in our 4th floor room worked (well, the wall clock did not the first night, but we noticed that it had been repaired by the second without any need for us to ask). The shower had a door, which I most appreciated. And it was a good strong shower with plenty of hot water. Floors have lots of old Turkish carpets, which could be problematic for those with breathing problems, though I have allergies and was not affected. We appreciated the free internet and the electric teakettle in the lobby to make a hot drink in the afternoon. This not a modern boutique hotel, but a homey , friendly place in an older building. I looked at many hotels online and feel that the Spectra was a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A complicated place--managers great but it badly needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: thekma
Reviews.Content: This is a hard review to write. Hotel Spectra has some strong pluses-- a wonderful, central yet quiet location, a lovely and helpful manager, good staff, and a terrific rooftop breakfast overlooking the Blue Mosque. But in spite of these pluses, the experience was not what we'd hoped for and the hotel seems overpriced for what it is. As someone else said here, I really wanted to like this hotel, especially since the staff was so nice and accommodating....but in the end, I felt it was desperately in need of some basic maintenance. We knew the rooms were extremely small when we booked and had no problem with that. However, due to asthma I had requested a well- ventilated room with windows and hopefully a view at the time of the booking. Since we were paying about 81 euros a night (US $125), we didn't really expect to get a view or to find a five star hotel, but we did expect a functional room. When we got there we were shown to a very small room on the first floor that had an unusually low ceiling (definitely not legal height by American standards) and two tiny floor -level windows that did not go higher than my knees. The curtain did not hang down low enough to cover the windows so that people on the street below could look up into the room, (Apparently, the first floor of the hotel had been created by dividing the ground floor into two stories). Several of the light fixtures in the room were broken, the room fridge did not work, and the bathroom shower was a pan and curtain affair that promised to leak. We politely explained that this was not what we had expected and asked for another room. We were told that the only rooms for three people were all located on the first floor and that all of these rooms were basically the same...with low ceiling and tiny low-on-the-wall windows. The staff, however, recognizing that the initial room was problematic, showed us to another room on the first floor that was slightly larger with windows a wee bit higher up (though still small and no higher up on the wall than my waist). As in the previous room, the curtains did not fully cover the windows leaving us exposed to people passing by on the street below, and letting the outside neon light into the room. Same lower than normal ceilings, again a non-functioning fridge and a broken wall light fixture, as well as wires dangling from one wall just outside the door. The bathroom, though very small, had been recently retiled and appeared cleaner. We moved into that room and decided to spend as little time in the room as possible...after all, it was only for sleeping. And, despite all the problems with the room, the bedding was wonderful--higher than normal quality sheets and comfortable beds! The ventilation, though, was poor, and we didn't sleep well.
