After our second night in that room, the manager graciously moved us to a dramatically better room which had become available for the final two nights in the hotel. This 3rd floor room was in the corner of the building and had a spectacular view of the Blue Mosque and square below. It was significantly larger and had normal height ceilings. Best of all, the bathroom had been redone and actually had a glass shower (rather than the cloth shower curtains of the rooms on the 1st floor). It was as though we were staying in a different hotel! I should say, though, that maintenance problems were still an issue in this much, much nicer room...and this was probably the best room in the hotel. The shower nozzle holder had broken off the wall, so when showering we had to hold the attachment in our hands and could not hang it on the wall...not a problem for us, but I could imagine others who'd paid more for this view room being frustrated by this. Likewise, two of the four light fixtures in the room were not functioning. The TV did not work at all...which we discovered when my husband and daughter spend a sick day in the room. Still, we were happy and grateful to have this room and have nothing but praise for the manager and staff. I guess the bottom line is that you do NOT want to stay on the first floor of this hotel. If you are a party of three you'd be wise to go elsewhere. But if you are a party of two and can reserve a room on the 3rd floor (especially the corner room), you'll probably be content.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views and breakfast, very very small room.”
Reviews.Author: emcentar
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel, but my feelings during our stay were a bit mixed. Like other reviewers have mentioned, the location is great, right on the corner of the Hippodrome, and steps from many of the attractions of Sultanahmet. The staff really tries to please, and although they forgot to arrange our airport pick-up, accommodated us in every other request. The views from the breakfast roof are wonderful. Internet access in the lobby was very handy. My chief disappointment was the room. It was small, dreary, and tired-looking. Like others have mentioned, the smallness is made worse by the fact that there's nowhere to stash suitcases, so what available floor space to maneuver is consumed by your bags. I do think that for one person, this room would have been fine, and a couple on a budget would probably also be fine, but for two family members on an extended trip, we were badly cramped. Although I had read in the Tripadvisor reviews that the rooms were small, I was used to the smaller hotel rooms in Europe and didn't think it would be a problem. But it really did put a damper on an otherwise wonderful trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Spectra on the up”
Reviews.Author: Shostakovitch
Reviews.Content: I have often stayed at the Spectra in the past. But I have noticed this time the improvement in the standard of decoration and care in the hotel. In particular it is the first time that I have stayed in a hotel in which I found the manageress checking the cleanliness standards. Sinan at the reception desk was also exceptionally helpful with the intricacies of the Turkish language. I look forward to returning to this gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: SK2008London
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - very very near to the Blue Mosque and Haiga Sofia. The hotel is very clean and the staff is very helpful and courteous. The views from the breakfast room are absolutely stunning. Ersin, the hotel's manager, was very helpful indeed and our trip would not have been half as fun if it wasn't for his advice. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Spectra-A fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DelawareDoodlebug
Reviews.Content: In June of 2008 we stayed a week and a half at the Spectra Hotel in Istanbul and were pleased with every aspect. Would we stay there again? Absolutely! The hotel location very near the Blue Mosque is extremely convenient. The staff could not have been more helpful or more pleasant. The hotel is clean, clean, clean. We enjoyed marvelous breakfasts on the top level with views of the Marmara, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and The Hippodrome. Definitely recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended central hotel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: johnnie_8
Reviews.Content: Perfect position on the corner of the Hippodrome and near the Blue Mosque. Very friendly and welcoming staff - any problems were sorted out immediately, They organised a car for airport transfers. Ersin on Reception was full of agood dvice on where to eat and he helped organise an overnight trip to Ephesus. Okay, the room and shower room were very small but it was clean and airconditioned, but when you are on a city holiday you don't lie around in your room all the time! The buffet breakfast was excellent - homemade apricot and cherry jam to die for and with a beautiful view of the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorous. If you want a central hotel on a budget then I really recommend the Hotel Spectra.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay-room too small”
Reviews.Author: swamisez
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 1 night on May 16 during our transit in Istanbul. Spectra is located right across from the Hippodrome and the Blue Mosque and I mean right across. So location is just perfect. The room we stayed in was the smallest room I've seen in my life. I don't know how they squeeze 3 beds in the room, a tv and a mini fridge. The room was clean though but sound proofing was non-existent. We could easily hear people talking in the street below. It once used to be a best western and still shows signs of their branding in the rooms. Breakfast is served on the terrace area with a beautiful view of the mosques. Bkfst was very the usual Turkish buffet and very good. The jams and bread were excellent. There are a couple of restaurants right next door and many more 5 minutes walk away. One of the night clerks tried to send us to their restaurant located 5 minute taxi drive away. After declining since we wanted a quick bite so we can get some rest, he was extremely disappointed!! Nothing wrong with the hotel, the room sizes are a bit small but it makes up for it in location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful family atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: TravelWhenever
Reviews.Content: SPECTRA HOTEL in the Sultanahmet District of old Istanbul is a true find! The location is perfect-right on the Hippodrome, across from the Blue Mosque and the owners welcome you as if you are family. Rooms all have private baths with showers and hairdryers, coffee maker, minibar, and TV with satellite programming. There is a lift, a cozy lobby with a living-room feeling, free internet access, safe boxes, and helpful reception staff. Before you go out on your daily forays, enjoy the wonderful Turkish breakfasts including various breads, eggs, yogurt, honey, marmalades/jams, tomatoes, olives, cereals and fruits. Even better is the view as you start your day: the breakfast room is on the top floor with huge windows looking out over the historic center's gems: the Blue Mosque, Hippodrome and Aya Sofya. In the other direction are sweeping panoramas of the Marmara Sea and Princes Islands. Rates are around $120 for a twin, depending on the season. When you book at least three nights, airport transfers are included. If SPECTRA is full, the Sumengen family has two other properties nearby. Ask about the new Ada Hotel, where two restored Ottoman houses have been combined to feature very large rooms and views of the Marmara Sea. Also the Sumengen Hotel behind the Blue Mosque, which will undergo a refurbishment the winter of 2008, is a great choice. These family-owned and run properties will make you feel like you are coming home to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Next to the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: Rick K
Reviews.Content: The location is second to none and within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi castle, etc etc. Althought the rooms are small the wonderful hospitality is second to none! Hatice and Ziya make you feel like one of the family! Great rates, breakfast and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “a very pleasant stay for 13 family group members from Malaysia”
Reviews.Author: MRSRADIN
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights at Spectra.We felt so at home as everyone was so nice and friendly. Most importantly we felt safe. The hotel location was perfect,the views were fabulous and the facilities near and around the hotel were added pluses to the hotel, especially its so near the important tourist sites, the restaurants, the bazaars ,the new tram system and yet its quiet at nights. The rooms though small were clean with good heating system,hot water for the showers,comfortable big beds,clean sheets and towels everyday, healthy breakfast with nice views at the rooftop. The only thing is the rooms on the first floor do not have any views where my son and his family happened to stay. Thank you Dr Ziya Sumengen and Hadijah- from Zabidah &family from Malaysia
